review_blob: Fantastic Session IPA. All hop flavor and aroma upfront with little to no drawbacks being a Session IPA. Wave after wave of hop flavor with resinous stickyness and oily hop feeling on the tongue. Just a tad bit dry on the aftertaste but very hard to complain about in this type of beer.

One of the most impressive Double IPAs in Quebec to date. I had it on tap at Vices et Versa but the recent bottle I had impressed me even more.

Off the bat, very strong tropical and fruity aromas with a hint of alcohol, very pleasant. Tastes just as good, slight alcohol note but nothing bothersome, still very fruity. The beer had some coagulated proteins and resins sitting at the bottom but had very little impact on the flavor.

After winning a gold medal in the World Beer Cup, I decided to revisit this beer since its debut.

Faint smell of chocolate and roasted malts. Definitely holds a moka taste with a slightly boozy kick to it. Although its a sweet stout, the sweetness fatigues my palate a bit too easily and makes it hard to enjoy a entire bottle of it. 

Its an easily available beer in Montreal and on the cheaper side, I definitely suggest to try it out with friends.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Connaisseur LExploit

review_blob: Piney and slightly fruity aroma and very piney tasting. Personally, the biterness is a bit on the harsh side and the pine taste is overpowering.

Contrary to the name, this beer isnt a proper table beer. The spiced aromas and taste are too out of balance to properly pair with food. I highly recommend drinking it at warmer temperatures to eliminate a good chunk of the harsh spice smell and taste to get a better glimpse of the actual Red Ale.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Festive  Table

review_blob:
Thanks to a friend for the hook up. This Double IPA is currently my favorite to date. Drinking such a tasty beer from a can engulfs you with constant hits of citrusy, earthy and floral American hop flavors and aromas.

The key to this beer is definitely "balance." All hops up front without being fussy or annoying in a very easy to drink package. Unfortunately it was so easy to drink I realized Ive drank half of the can in no time. 

Heady Topper to me is a celebration of craft beers, a quality beer that has taste and aroma that should be drank and enjoyed as much as possible rather than be seen as a mystical beast.

Although there are many APAs in Quebec that many would argue that are better, this beer is definitely is my go to APA because it is the few impressive APAs that are bottled in 12 ounces. The convenience of a tasty single serving APA is hard to come by in Montreal.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Connaisseur LInterdite 60 Minutes
